title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description:
When invoking the New Java Package wizard, a confusing message appears at the top when the package name field is empty. I would like clarification on what this message means and whether it is an error. If it is an error, it should be displayed in red with an error icon.

NOTES: EG (5/1/2001 5:53:41 AM) - There should be no error message when the package name field is empty and the 'Finish' button should be disabled.

MA (5/2/01 9:34:00 AM) - It is a warning. I will remove the message.

EG (5/2/01 9:43:44 AM) - How can a default package be created? It can't be created by the user since it always exists.
OB: When invoking the New Java Package wizard and before typing anything, a message appears at the top saying 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'.
EB:
When invoking the New Java Package wizard and before typing anything, a message appears at the top saying 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. I would like clarification on what this message means and whether it is an error. If it is an error, it should be displayed in red with an error icon.

NOTES: EG (5/1/2001 5:53:41 AM) - There should be no error message when the package name field is empty and the 'Finish' button should be disabled.

MA (5/2/01 9:34:00 AM) - It is a warning. I will remove the message.

EG (5/2/01 9:43:44 AM) - How can a default package be created? It can't be created by the user since it always exists.
SR:
1. Open the New Java Package wizard.
2. Leave the package name field empty.
3. Observe the message that appears at the top of the wizard.
